job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Netherlands
       Machine Learning Engineer
       32 - 40 hours a week
         Are you a skilled machine learning engineer with a strong background in algorithm development and implementation?
         Are you looking for a role that combines hands-on technical work with consulting?
         Do you get satisfaction from seeing your models and algorithms being used in real-world applications?
         Do you enjoy being part of a team of experts who are passionate about machine learning and AI?
       Then Xomnia is the place for you!
       As a Machine Learning Engineer at Xomnia, your work for our clients will range from building data pipelines to data exploration and modeling, to productionizing your models and deploying them in a cloud environment. For instance, our team has developed scalable deployment pipelines using MLOps best-practices for a large insurance company in the Netherlands, enabling business teams to swiftly productionize a machine learning model for a new department.
       Additionally, we have undertaken diverse projects, such as optimizing the electricity grid for the future, ensured you have stable internet connection at home and collaborated with LUMC on cancer research.
       Together with the team, you will implement and adapt best-practises for modeling, programming and engineering using the latest MLOps principles, which includes automation, CI/CD and orchestration. These principles apply to the whole chain of the machine learning lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and monitoring. We value knowledge sharing and staying ahead of the curve in our constantly evolving field, with opportunities to explore and work with emerging technologies such as Generative AI. We are looking for a team player who is dedicated to keep learning, and enjoys sharing knowledge with others.
       Please note that for this position, we are looking for candidates that have the legal right to work in the Netherlands as we do not offer visa sponsorship.
       What you will be working on
          + Collaborating with a cross-functional team at our client to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learning
          + Designing and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniques
          + Developing and maintaining machine learning pipelines, including feature preparation, model training, model deployment and model serving using MLOps principles.
          + Analyzing and interpreting results to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement
          + Staying up-to-date with the latest machine learning techniques and technologies and apply them to business problems as appropriate
          + Following and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CD
       What you will need
job_details.full_text:
Machine Learning Engineer

Amsterdam, Noord-Holland, Netherlands
       Machine Learning Engineer
       32 - 40 hours a week
         Are you a skilled machine learning engineer with a strong background in algorithm development and implementation?
         Are you looking for a role that combines hands-on technical work with consulting?
         Do you get satisfaction from seeing your models and algorithms being used in real-world applications?
         Do you enjoy being part of a team of experts who are passionate about machine learning and AI?
       Then Xomnia is the place for you!
       As a Machine Learning Engineer at Xomnia, your work for our clients will range from building data pipelines to data exploration and modeling, to productionizing your models and deploying them in a cloud environment. For instance, our team has developed scalable deployment pipelines using MLOps best-practices for a large insurance company in the Netherlands, enabling business teams to swiftly productionize a machine learning model for a new department.
       Additionally, we have undertaken diverse projects, such as optimizing the electricity grid for the future, ensured you have stable internet connection at home and collaborated with LUMC on cancer research.
       Together with the team, you will implement and adapt best-practises for modeling, programming and engineering using the latest MLOps principles, which includes automation, CI/CD and orchestration. These principles apply to the whole chain of the machine learning lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and monitoring. We value knowledge sharing and staying ahead of the curve in our constantly evolving field, with opportunities to explore and work with emerging technologies such as Generative AI. We are looking for a team player who is dedicated to keep learning, and enjoys sharing knowledge with others.
       Please note that for this position, we are looking for candidates that have the legal right to work in the Netherlands as we do not offer visa sponsorship.
       What you will be working on
          + Collaborating with a cross-functional team at our client to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learning
          + Designing and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniques
          + Developing and maintaining machine learning pipelines, including feature preparation, model training, model deployment and model serving using MLOps principles.
          + Analyzing and interpreting results to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement
          + Staying up-to-date with the latest machine learning techniques and technologies and apply them to business problems as appropriate
          + Following and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CD
       What you will need

profile_classification.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes core machine learning engineering tasks such as algorithm development, data pipelines, modeling, and productionizing models using MLOps principles. While Generative AI is mentioned as an emerging technology to explore, the primary focus and responsibilities described align more closely with traditional ML Engineer roles centered around predictive modeling and operationalizing ML systems.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'understanding business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learning' directly relates to understanding the business context and aligning technical solutions.
job_tasks.phrase: understand business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learning

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'building data pipelines' and 'feature preparation' are core components of data engineering.
The phrase 'feature preparation' is a key step in the data engineering process for machine learning.
The phrase 'algorithm development and implementation' and 'Designing and implementing machine learning models' are central to the modeling task.
The phrase 'Designing and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniques' directly describes the modeling process.
job_tasks.phrase: Designing and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniques

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'data exploration and modeling' covers both understanding data and building models.
The phrase 'model training' is a fundamental part of the modeling lifecycle.
The phrase 'programming' is a core software development activity, especially when applied to ML models and pipelines.
The phrase 'deploying them in a cloud environment' and 'model deployment' involve software engineering practices for making models accessible.
job_tasks.phrase: deploying them in a cloud environment

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'model deployment' is a software development task focused on releasing models into production.
The phrase 'model serving' refers to the software engineering aspect of making trained models available for predictions.
The phrase 'productionizing your models' and 'productionize a machine learning model' directly relates to MLOps and getting models into a production environment.
The phrase 'scalable deployment pipelines using MLOps best-practices' explicitly mentions MLOps and deployment pipelines.
job_tasks.phrase: scalable deployment pipelines using MLOps best-practices

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'implement and adapt best-practises for modeling, programming and engineering using the latest MLOps principles' clearly indicates a focus on MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: implement and adapt best-practises for modeling, programming and engineering using the latest MLOps principles

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'automation, CI/CD and orchestration' are key components of MLOps and operations engineering.
The phrase 'whole chain of the machine learning lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and monitoring' describes the scope of MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: whole chain of the machine learning lifecycle, from ideation to deployment and monitoring

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'model serving using MLOps principles' combines model serving with MLOps practices.
The phrase 'Following and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CD' highlights adherence to MLOps and engineering best practices.
job_tasks.phrase: Following and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CD
